sentences.en: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.cn: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

sentences.en: Analysts warn us away from drawing any conclusions.
sentences.cn: 分析家劝告我们不要妄下结论。

sentences.en: And, they warn, the holiday season may make it worse.
sentences.cn: 探员们还警告说, 这种情况可能随着假日的到来而更加严重.

sentences.en: Economists warn that enormous pressures could build up, forcing people to emigrate westwards.
sentences.cn: 经济学家警告，迫使人们向西部迁移的压力可能会增至很大的程度。

sentences.en: He warn't any more responsible than a colt.
sentences.cn: 他只不过还是个毛头孩子.

sentences.en: However, three crazy animals are coming to warn them of the trouble.
sentences.cn: 不过三只疯狂的动物正前来警告它们这场灾难.

sentences.en: I had to be cruel to be kind and warn him that he'd lose his job if he didn't improve his performance.
sentences.cn: 我只得忠言逆耳地警告他,如果他的表现不改进的话,他会失业的.

sentences.en: I tried to warn him, but he wouldn't listen.
sentences.cn: 我设法提醒过他，可他就是不听。

sentences.en: I'll run ahead and warn them.
sentences.cn: 我要跑在前头，警告他们。

sentences.en: It is incumbent upon you to warn them.
It is my duty to warn you.
sentences.cn: 我有责任向你提出警告.

sentences.en: One of them would keep a look-out on the road behind to warn us of approaching vehicles.
sentences.cn: 他们中会有一人看着后面的路，提醒我们注意过来的车辆。

sentences.en: Signs across the entrances warn all visitors to stub out their cigarettes.
sentences.cn: 入口处的告示牌提醒游客们熄灭香烟。

sentences.en: Soon an official appeared to warn them away.
sentences.cn: 很快一位官员出来劝告他们离开。

sentences.en: Teachers warn today that Latin, Greek and other classics will be squeezed out of school timetables.
sentences.cn: 老师们今天发出警告说，拉丁语、古希腊语和其他古典文学将被挤出学校的课程表。

sentences.en: You'd be always into that sugar if I warn't watching you. "
sentences.cn: 要不是我看得紧,你恨不得钻到糖堆里不出来. ”

phrases.tran_cn: 警告（某人）离开，告诫（某人）不得靠近
(赛马)（因违反赛马俱乐部的规定）禁止…参加比赛

trans.tran_en: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it
to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it
